thread.title: If you are going to Friday Night Lights
thread.title_full: If you are going to Friday Night Lights | www.ajc.com

author: D. Orlando Ledbetter
title: If you are going to Friday Night Lights
text:
The Falcons will run a regular practice at the team’s Friday Night Lights event at 7:20 p.m. Friday night at Buford High School.
The practice is open to the public and gates will open at 6 p.m.
After the practice, there will be an autograph session and a fireworks show.
ccompton@ajc.com 073115 FLOWERY BRANCH: Falcons head coach Dan Quinn (from left) shares a laugh with quarterback T.J. Yates, safety William Moore, and quarterback Matt Ryan after Moore broke up a play during the first day of training camp on Friday, July 31, 2015, in Flowery Branch. Curtis Compton / ccompton@ajc.com Also, to celebrate USA Football month, several boys and girls from local Leagues will be represented on the field.
“It will be really similar to what we’ve experienced here at practice,” Falcons coach Dan Quinn said. “(We want) to move the ball, some team runs and some one-on-ones. It’ll kind of be an extension here, and we’ll bring our show on the road.
“That’s kind of what I’m most excited to do, is to get connected with the fans, but as far as our process it’ll feel really similar to what you’ve experienced with the guys so far through this first week and a half of camp.”
